ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with this course compared to others you have taken was:
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
How would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other F&ES courses you have taken?
Given the course objectives, the level of intellectual challenge of the material covered was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Teamwork, communication, report writing, etc.

I enjoyed having to interact with a client frequently and dealing with different communications styles. It is hard to work with a team that is different from you, but it is rewarding at the same time.
Business consulting, client-facing, data analysis, data visualization, teamwork. Wood supply chain (through my course client)
Communication, research skills

The relation with the client was good but Maureen was not at all engaging. The class projects need to improve so that clients have a real commitment to improving their sustainability and not just looking for extra work to spare.
Team work was an important component in this class, and is not usually as focal in other classes. Professional communication with conference calls.
Consulting experience.
The majority of the course is focused on the client project. It was a great experience to learn how to be a consultant and very rewarding to work with a team towards a final goal.
Consulting for busines
Working directly with a consulting client on environmental sustainability issues was an insightful and educational experience.

narratives.question_text: How well did the knowledge, skills, and insights gained in this class align with your expectations?
comments: Good.
My expectations were that this would be a hands on course with lots of knowledge sharing between the team, lots of meetings and learning how to time manage.
Very well
They aligned with expectations
More or less.
It was a very practical experience, both in the content of the project and in the team work we had to coordinate internally. It was exactly what I was looking for.
Yes.
The course aligned with my expectations.
Very well
They did not meet my expectations, overall.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of the course and how could it be improved?
comments: Very project-dependent, which makes it somewhat risky to take depending on what you're hoping to get out of it. Many of the guest lectures were fairly repetitive and didn't seem a great use of time. The lectures early-on from Maureen could have been more engaging and deeper, felt somewhat rudimentary and not new information (basics of powerpoint). It's neat that it's set up as a client class, which brings a unique perspective to the course.
I think more hands on team assessments would be useful. i.e. based on your feedback this is what I think this team would need and should do.

Strengths: Very defined outline and structure of the course throughout the semester and the instructor also gave sufficient time for students to interact with clients besides classes. The instructor gave helpful feedback throughout the semester and invited sustainability-focused consultants to share their experience during class. Weakness: The course experience highly varies due to clients. It usually took up to three to four weeks on average to start working on projects efficiently. Mid-term presentations happened right before spring break, leaving two to three weeks for students to actually work on the project.
More feedback and supervision on projects
Weaknesses: Only white speakers came to class. Very biased perspectives.

This class can tailor to a lot of different kinds of students and can lead to a new experience each time. The lectures were not necessarily tied to our projects, but they offered interesting insights into the life of a consultant that we could maybe draw parallels to in our class projects. It was also useful how there were feedback opportunities built into the course. Everything was direct.
It's great! Maureen does an awesome job at organizing the clients.

The in-class time was mostly guest speakers who work within the business and environment space. I would have liked to have a few classes that were workshop-based that helped us build consulting/team work/presentation skills. I took the sustainable entrepreneurship consultancy class this semester, and that class did a group job of curating the in-class time to help us improve our performance for the client projects. I would recommend talking to Peter Boyd who was the faculty advisor for that class, to ask him about running workshops during class time.
Real life projects are the best thing about the course. Success of project can vary between clients.
Strength: opportunity to engage directly with corporate clients. Weakness: in-class presentations were fairly weak and flat.

narratives.question_text: What advice would you give to a student considering taking this class?
comments: It's a good class but be ready for lots of work!
Pick a project with a clear goal from the potential client.
Communicate with client often
Only take it if you really like the project.

Be sure to allot enough time in your semester to work on this project for your client, but more importantly for your teammates. It's a great way to try out a potential career as a consultant without leaving school.
Definitely.
I would definitely recommend taking this class to get some hands-on experience working with a client and as part of a team. It's great for your resume and your own personal/professional development.
Choose client project wiseley.
To worry less about the course content and focus on learning as much as they can from the client.
